formattedAddress: 21 South End Ave #1, New York, NY 10280, USA
adrFormatAddress: 21 South End Ave #1, New York, NY 10280, USA

originalText.text: The more you are a loyal customer the more they will take advantage of that loyalty. The most recent time not delivering my clothes for 6 days, or even picking them up for 2 days after I call when they promise 2 day drop off. They lost my business by taking longer and longer each time to clean only a few shirts to the point of unacceptability and I would not recommend anyone be their customer.

originalText.text: Have always had a good experience here with both dry cleaning suits and dresses and wash and fold. I'm so grateful to Om who helped me out by moving up my delivery a day to accommodate a change in travel plans! Very responsive, great customer service!

text.text: Have always had a good experience here with both dry cleaning suits and dresses and wash and fold. I'm so grateful to Om who helped me out by moving up my delivery a day to accommodate a change in travel plans! Very responsive, great customer service!

originalText.text: I used New Fresh Cleaners for years and then Four seasons took over the business.  I ran into an issue where half my laundry went missing.  I have gone back 6 times to try and talk to the manager and I am told every time he is not available but will call me to compensate for the lost laundry.  No one ever calls.  I'm very disappointed with this service.  Would not recommend at all.

text.text: I used New Fresh Cleaners for years and then Four seasons took over the business.  I ran into an issue where half my laundry went missing.  I have gone back 6 times to try and talk to the manager and I am told every time he is not available but will call me to compensate for the lost laundry.  No one ever calls.  I'm very disappointed with this service.  Would not recommend at all.

originalText.text: DO NOT USE.  Dropped off two new suits, and they came back with two creases in the front of the suit pants.  I then brought them back and asked to have it corrected, and was met with hostility and was told I was going to have to pay to get them pressed again.  After minutes of arguing, they agreed to do it for free, and one of the pants came back the 2nd time  with double creases.  I ended up having to take it to a new dry cleaner to have it pressed a 3rd time.

originalText.text: I dropped off a rug for cleaning over a month ago. They returned it 2 weeks later uncleaned.  It smelled of dog and the stains were not removed. Some guests were over and we all agreed the job was not done. I asked them to take it back the same day. They did reluctantly but they later told me there was video proof that it had been cleaned. Today, I called to ask when it would be ready. The man on the phone replied, “oh my god, I told you when you called 10 days ago it would be 2 weeks. We have pictures that show it was cleaned. It’s not my job.” I had to remind him if he takes money for services offered, it is his job to provide said service. He used words like “frustrating” and implied I was difficult (sexist). I just checked my credit card statement and I was charged on 9/3. If you say 2 weeks, 5 and a half weeks is a reasonable time to inquire about property you’re holding. Negative stars for customer service. I wish I never used this place.
